titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Photograph collection of a group portrait of the Flatbush Veterans of Foreign Wars and three studio portraits of unidentified people V1991.119
titlestmt.author: Patricia Glowinski
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:11:33 +0000.

did.unittitle: Photograph collection of a group portrait of the Flatbush Veterans of Foreign Wars and three studio portraits of unidentified people

physdesc.extent: four items housed in one folder.

did.abstract: The Photograph collection of a group portrait of the Flatbush Veterans of Foreign Wars and three studio portraits of unidentified people dates from circa 1870 to 1933 and contains four items.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Photograph collection of a group portrait of the Flatbush Veterans of Foreign Wars and three studio portraits of unidentified people dates from circa 1870 to 1933 and contains four items. Includes is one small black-and-white photographic print showing a group portrait of members of the Flatbush Veterans of Foreign Wars, taken in Poughkeepsie, N.Y. on September 18, 1933. Also in the collection are two cabinet photographs showing portraits of an unidentified young man and a middle-aged woman with the name "Mrs. Hankins" handwritten on the recto. Both cabinet photographs were produced at Brooklyn photography studios. The last photograph in the collection is tintype that shows a young man seated, dressed in a suit with a hat and cane. It is not known if the people in the photographs are related in any way.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Reproduction rights for the photographs have not been evaluated. For information on securing rights to publish or reproduce, please see the Brooklyn Historical Society Reproduction Rights Policy.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition for this collection are unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1991.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: Item level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library. Please consult library staff for more information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Photograph collection of a group portrait of the Flatbush Veterans of Foreign Wars and three studio portraits of unidentified people, V1991.119, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level.
